is measured as the standard deviation of the residuals from the firm’s R&D expenditure trend over the past five years divided by the five-year mean expenditure, KZ measures financial constraints, ROA is net income divided by total assets, ME is market capitalization, BE is book equity, and Momentum is the lagged six-month return. Industry classifications are based on the Fama-French Siccodes5 definitions. T stats are in parentheses.

cell.text: Firms listed in the US between 1980 and 2018
Selecting firms with the ratios of R&D expense to Sales (R&D) that are less than unity and firms for which we can calculate standard deviations of R&D during the sample period
Matching with monthly stock return data
Considering the main variable of interest R&D expenditure volatility
